With the Product policy, each product has a unique brand. With the Class policy, all products in the same class use the same brand.
Automatically apply technology advances to manufacturing units
New products default to Internal Sales
Show only products with corporate activity

The quality of {0} is determined by:
Currently no producers in this region
Grown in a Crop Growing slot in a Farm
Made in a Livestock Processing slot in a Farm
Made in a Logging slot in a Logging camp
Made in a Manufacturing slot in a Factory
Made in a Mining slot in a Mine
Made in an Oil Extraction slot in an Oil Well
The Stock Exchange does not allow this trade.
Learn how natural resources work and how to refine Timber into Bookshelf and sell at a store
Learn how to build stores, purchase goods and selling them at a profit
Learn how to raise livestock and grow crops
Learn how to produce goods in factories
In this tutorial you'll learn how to go from a natural resource to a refined product sold in a store.
First we'll find a suitable product to make.
Click the products button to open the list of all product types
Let's have a look at Bookshelf. Click on it to select it.
Here we see what it takes to make bookshelves. The only input is Timber whose quality determines 40% of the quality of the bookshelf.
Your technology level also affects the quality of bookshelves. Your current level is 30 of 100. Here we see that it determines the remaining 60%.
Let's start making bookshelves. Close this window by clicking the X in the corner

Since the input is Timber, we need a logging camp. If there were any competitors selling Timber or a seaport importing Timber, we could buy from there. We're alone in this region, so we need to build our own camp.
Click the Natural Resources button to open the list of resources in the region
There's only one forest so select this. If there were several, you'd need to compare quality, reserve and price to find the one you want.
You can't simply build a logging camp. First you need to buy the resource at an auction. Click the button to start an auction
If there were any competitors, they could bid on this resource and you could make another bid. Wait for the timer in the corner to reach zero.
Congratulations - you won the auction and are now the proud owner of a logging camp. Now you'll need to add a logging unit to chop wood. Click the plus button

A Logging camp is a Medium-sized building. Medium buildings have space for 13 units. When adding units to buildings, you can choose Small, Medium or Large units. Small units have a size of 1. Medium is the same as two Small and Large is same as two Medium.
Medium-sized buildings have 14 slots for units. A unit takes up 1 slot regardless of the unit's size
Select a Medium logging unit. A Medium unit works twice has fast as a Small and half as fast as a Large.
Stock tells you how many units (of Timber) is stored inside the unit.

Utilization tells you how busy the unit is. If this is at 100% for many days, the unit is too busy to do all its work. In this case you can consider increasing the training level, upgrading to a bigger unit or building a second unit. Many new units start at 100% because they work hard to fill the stock storage (which of course is initially empty).
The reserve tells you how much Timber remains in the forest. When this reaches zero, the logging camp is destroyed.
The quality of this Timber is the value that will affect the final quality of your bookshelves.
Wages is the monthly wages paid to this unit's employees
The efficiency shows you how fast the unit works. A unit at 66% works twice as fast as a unit at 33%. All units start at 33%.
Efficiency can be increased by spending money on training.
You'll also need a sales unit to sell the Timber. Click the plus button
Connect the logging and sales units by clicking the arrow. Timber will flow from Logging to Sales.
We've finished setting up the logging camp. Your Timber is now available on the market. Close the window
We're done with natural resources, so close that window as well.
Now that we have Timber, we need a factory that can refine it into bookshelves.
Place the factory in the region. Move it so it's adjacent to a road.
Note that you are building a Small-sized factory
You need a Purchasing unit to buy the Timber from your logging camp. Click the plus button
Small buildings have capacity for 6 units.
Small buildings only have 9 slots and also have arrows in fewer directions than the Medium buildings
Select the Timber you're selling. You know it's the Timber you are making because it has your corporation's color
You need a Manufacturing unit to make bookshelves. Click the plus button
Connect the Purchasing and Manufacturing units by clicking the arrow. Timber will flow from Purchasing to Manufacturing.
You need to tell your Manufacturing unit what to make. Click the Select Product button
You'll also need a Sales unit to sell the bookshelves. Click the plus button
Now connect your Manufacturing and Sales units. Bookshelves will flow from Manufacturing to Sales.
You've set up the full manufacturing line for bookshelves. Close the window
Now you're building bookshelves, but your customers can't buy directly from a factory. You need a store.
Place the store inside the city (close to the houses). Land costs more inside the city, but you'll get more customers. It needs to be adjacent to a road.
You need a Purchasing and a Sales unit. Click the plus button for new products to automatically add both.
We only need small units. Confirm the selection.
A new product doesn't appear on the products list until the Purchasing unit has bought bookshelves and they've flowed to the Sales unit
Notice that your bookshelves are now being bought by people and every day the number of sold units increase
You are all done. You can close the window.
You've completed the tutorial. You've learned how to build and sell products based on natural resources
In this tutorial you'll learn about retailing - buying and selling products in stores
First we'll build a store. Stores need to be close to people to attract shoppers. You can build it on the outskirts of town or you can buy out some home owners and place it in the middle of downtown.
Now you need to place the store somewhere in the world. The only requirement is that it has access to a road, but it's smart to build it close to people. A green outline means a valid location.
You could build a medium or large store, but we'll stick with a small store. Bigger costs more, but can sell more products. Press the Build button to confirm your store location.
Before you can sell something, you need to buy something. First we need a Purchasing unit. Click the plus button.
Now you need to select what to purchase. Click the Select supplier button.

In this tutorial we do not have many options. All that is available are the two goods imported by the seaport. In a regular game you'd find products produced by you and your competitors here as well. Select board games.
Confirm your selection. Your Purchasing unit will start buying board games from the Seaport.
Stock shows you how many units are stored by your purchasing unit.
Supply shows you the seller's supply-situation (compared to demand). If this bar is not full, the seller is not able to sell you as much as you want to buy
Demand shows you the demand for the seller's goods.
This shows you the utilization of your purchasing unit. If this is at 100%, your unit is overworked and not able to buy as much as you need.
This shows you the price you pay per unit to the seller
This shows you the cost of shipping one unit from the seller to you
This shows you the quality of the product
This shows you the brand rating of the product
You also need a Sales unit to sell the board games. Click the plus button.
You need to connect the Purchasing and Sales unit by clicking the arrow. Note the direction of the arrow - goods can only flow one way. Click the arrow.
Board games will now flow from your Purchasing unit to your Sales unit. A Store's Sales unit will sell to the region's population
This shows you how many units your sales unit has in stock. Stock flows into here from your Purchasing unit
This shows you your supply situation. If the bar is not full, you are not able to meet the demand for this product.
This shows you the demand for this product.
This shows you how busy your Sales unit is. If it is at 100%, you need to consider increasing the training level or upgrading to a bigger unit.
This shows you the brand rating for the product.
This shows you this unit's monthly advertising spending. You can use the slider to change the spending.
The top of this window lists the products you are selling. Another way to start selling a new product is to click the plus button here. Do that
This time select the building blocks.
Purchasing and Sales units will be built for you automatically. You just need to select what size you want. Leave both as Small and click the Build button.
This shows you your product's rating
This shows you the average rating of this product in this region. If this is significantly higher than your rating, your sales will be slow.
This shows the detailed rating of the three factors that make up the product rating; Brand, Quality and Price.
This shows you the same average ratings for the region
This shows you how much the people in this region care about each of the factors. This varies for each product and also from one region to another.
Close the window by clicking the X in the corner
You've completed the tutorial. You've learned how to build a store and sell products
In this tutorial you will learn the basics of farming.||You will raise chickens for eggs and chicken meat, grow wheat, and learn how to increase the quality of both your livestock and crops.
First you will need to build a farm.||Click the Build button
Change to a Medium farm. Small farms can't grow crops, only raise livestock.
Place the farm building in the region view. You need to place it next to a road and you shouldn't place it within the town since land cost more there.||You can move around the region with arrow keys.
Good - now you just need to confirm construction of the farm. We'll use the default Medium size.

Now that your farm is built, you need to add the units that will do the actual farming. First we start with a Livestock Raising unit to raise chickens. Click the plus-icon to add a new unit in that slot.
Click the Medium Livestock Raising unit.||Livestock Raising units are .....
Now you need to select which livestock to raise in this unit. Click the Select Livestock button

The Supply and demand bars tells you if you've got enough animals. If the blue supply bar is longer than the red demand bar, you have enough animals. If the demand bar is longer, your Livestock Raising unit is not able to provide enough animals for all of your Livestock Processing units.
The quality of your livestock starts out low. All products processed from this will share the same quality.
The quality can be raised by monthly spending on quality improvement. Drag the slider so the monthly spending is at least 200,000
The herd size is based on the unit's efficiency. A more efficient unit is able to handle a larger herd.
The efficiency shows how many animals the unit can handle. The unit starts at 33%. If the unit is trained to 66% efficiency, the herd will be twice the size.
To increase efficiency you need to increase the training level. Use the slider to set this to at least 50%.
Now you need to add a Livestock Processing unit. This unit processes livestock from a Livestock Raising unit into finished products. Click the plus-icon to add a new unit.
Click the button for small Livestock Processing unit

Now that you have both a Livestock Raising unit and a Livestock Processing unit, we need to connect them so that the Processing unit can get livestock from the Raising unit. Click the arrow pointing from Livestock Raising to Livestock Processing.
Now you need to select what product to process the chicken into. Click the Select Product button

The Supply and demand bars tells you if you're processing enough animals into finished products.||If the red demand bar is longer, your Livestock Processing unit is not able to satisfy the current demand.

The utilization shows how busy the unit is. If it stays at 100%, the unit is too busy to process as much Chicken as requested. In this case, you should increase efficiency, upgrade to a bigger unit or build a second unit.
The efficiency shows how fast the unit works. The unit starts at 33%. If the unit is trained to 66% efficiency, it will process twice as much chicken.
To increase efficiency you need to increase the training level. Use the slider to set this to at least 50%.
Now chicken gets processed into chicken meat. Now you just need a Sales unit to sell your meat. Click the plus-icon to add a 3rd unit.
Now connect the Livestock Processing unit with the Sales unit to start selling your meat. Click the arrows between the units.
In addition to meat, chickens also provide eggs. You need a new Livestock Processing unit to get the eggs from your chicken. Click the plus-icon to add a new unit.
Again select the small Livestock Processing unit
Connect the Livestock Raising unit we built at the start with the new Livestock Processing unit. Click the arrow to connect them.
To sell your eggs, we need a second sales Unit. Click the plus-icon.
Click the arrow to connect your new Livestock Processing unit to your new Sales unit
Now you will grow your first crop. For this you will need a Crop Growing unit. Click the plus-icon to add it.
Click the small Crop Growing unit
Now you need to select which crop to grow. Click the Select Crop button
Select Corn. Notice how it is sown in a specific month and harvested in another.
Stock shows how much Corn is stored by this unit. This will increase during the harvest month. When harvesting starts, any old Corn here will be discarded.
This shows you the quality of the Corn. You can increase this by investing in Quality improvement
This shows you the progress of the Corn. Corn is planted in May and harvested in October. Until you have your first harvest, no Corn will be available from this farm.
The efficiency determines how much Corn the unit is able to harvest during the harvesting month. Increasing the Training level will increase the harvest.
When harvesting starts, the crop growing unit clears its existing inventory. Add an inventory unit to have extra storage space for the crops. Click the plus-icon.
Click the arrow to connect your Crop Growing unit to your new Inventory unit.
To sell your corn you need a new Sales unit. Click the plus-icon.
Again select the small Sales unit
Click the arrow to connect your Inventory unit to your new Sales unit.
Your corn won't be ready for selling until it has grown and been harvested. We won't wait for this in this tutorial. Click the X to close the window.
In this tutorial you learned how to raise livestock and process them into finished products and you learned how to grow crops.
In this tutorial you learned how to produce goods in factories
Place the factory in the region. It needs to be adjacent to a road. Notice the land cost - closer to the city is more expensive.
Confirm your location. You could build a small or large factory, but we'll stick with a medium factory in this tutorial.
You need a Manufacturing unit to manufacture a product. Click the plus button.
You need to select a product to manufacture. Click the Select Product button.
We don't have many choices in this tutorial. Select socks.
Note how we need Wool and Textiles to make socks. We need to purchase both of these products.
Press the plus button to build the first Purchasing unit
Link the two units so the products bought by the Purchasing unit can flow to the Manufacturing unit
Next you'll need to select a supplier. Click the Select supplier button
Next you'll need another Purchasing unit to buy textiles. Click the plus button
Connect the Purchasing unit to the Manufacturing unit. Click the arrow.
This shows you the amount of textiles stored in the Purchasing unit. This will flow to Manufacturing.

Note the supply and demand bars. These are for the textiles sold by the Seaport. If demand becomes bigger than supply, the seaport can't supply enough textiles and you might need to look for another supplier.
Sometimes the supply stops, either because a factory stops making something or a seaport stops importing. In this case, the Purchasing unit can look for a replacement supplier.
You also need a Sales unit to sell your socks. Click the plus button
Connect the Processing and Sales units so socks can flow to Sales. Click the arrow
This shows you the amount of finished product stored in the unit. Stock from here will flow to Sales as needed.
This shows you the amount of Wool stored in this unit, ready for being used in production
This shows you the amount of Textiles stored in this unit, ready for being used in production
This shows you how busy the Manufacturing unit is. If this stays at 100%, the unit is too busy to make enough products.
This part tells you the quality of your finished product.
This shows you how the quality is calculated. It is the sum of the value for each of the input products and the technology level.

This shows you the technology level in use by this unit, as well as your corporation's technology level. This unit use level 30 of your corporations tech level of 30. The highest tech level in the world is 100.
The efficiency tells you how fast your unit is working. A unit with 100% efficiency can produce twice as many products as a unit with 50% efficiency.
When you research technology advancements, the unit can automatically start using this technology. The downside is that efficiency will drop as your workers are not familier with the new tech.
To increase your technology level, you need to build research labs.
Place the building next to a road.
Click the plus button to add a unit
Click the button to select research project
Select a 2-year project. Longer projects gives higher advancment per month.
In two years the research will be completed and your tech level advances.
In this tutorial you learned how to produce goods in factories
